Geothermal Heat Pump.Description: Geothermal heat pumps use the natural heat from the Earth to provide heating and cooling for buildings.
Geothermal heat pumps are a type of ground source heat pump that utilize the constant temperature of the ground to efficiently heat and cool buildings.
Geothermal heat pumps contribute to the production of renewable heat, reducing the reliance on fossil fuels for heating and cooling.
Geothermal heat pumps rely on the principles of heat transfer to extract and transfer heat between the ground and the building.
